title: Augusta County: John Scott to E. P. Smith, April 29, 1869
summary: Scott writes to E. P. Smith to make arrangements for summer school, asking if there is a "teacher farther South who would be willing to stop on her way home and remain all summer here! There is a room large enough for one teacher without renting." Scott also mentions the possibility of receiving the "Bureau's" assistance in constructing a new schoolhouse in Staunton.
keywords: African Americans, Education, Economy, Women, Race Relations, American Civil War
